title: Forecasting Australian Real Wages Growth Rates
text:
Abstract. This project employs a Bayesian Vector Autoregression (BVAR) model to forecast Australian real wages growth rates for future periods. Beginning in 2021, Australian households experienced negative growth rates in real wages, but recent trends indicate a rebound. Therefore, a positive trajectory in real wages growth rate is anticipated for the upcoming periods.
Keywords. BVARs, Real Wages Growth Rates, Inflation, Households

title: Forecasting Australian Real Wages Growth Rates
text:
Theory base
Real Wages defined as:
\[\begin{gather}
\log Real\:wages = \log Nominal\:wages\:- \log CPI
\end{gather}\]

title: Forecasting Australian Real Wages Growth Rates
text:
Data extraction and transformation
Since our main indicators are based on quarterly data, all indicators are converted into quarterly time series.
Given that the extracted time series data for the production price index starts in 1998 Q4, we will use this as the starting date for our analysis.

Data Plots
The accompanying graphs depict the recent trends in the selected economic indicators. Notably, the Wage Price Index (WPI) has shown an upward trajectory recently, while the Consumer Price Index (CPI) has concurrently exhibited a decline. This divergence has facilitated a recovery in the real WPI from previously negative growth rates experienced in the post-COVID period. Additionally, significant increases have been observed in the growth rates of the Cost of Living Index and the Producer Price Index, highlighting notable shifts in economic conditions.
